components.name: WaAnimatedImage
components.description: A component for displaying animated GIFs and WEBPs that play and pause on interaction.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The path to the image to load.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: A description of the image used by assistive devices.

attributes.name: play
attributes.description: Plays the animation. When this attribute is remove, the animation will pause.

events.name: wa-load
events.description: Emitted when the image loads successfully.

events.name: wa-error
events.description: Emitted when the image fails to load.

slots.name: play-icon
slots.description: Optional play icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: pause-icon
slots.description: Optional pause icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssProperties.name: --control-box-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the icon box.

cssProperties.name: --icon-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the play/pause icons.

cssParts.name: control-box
cssParts.description: The container that surrounds the pause/play icons and provides their background.

components.name: WaAnimation
components.description: Animate elements declaratively with nearly 100 baked-in presets, or roll your own with custom keyframes. Powered by the [Web Animations API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Animations_API).

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the built-in animation to use. For custom animations, use the `keyframes` prop.

attributes.name: play
attributes.description:
Plays the animation. When omitted, the animation will be paused. This attribute will be automatically removed when
the animation finishes or gets canceled.

attributes.name: delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.
[Learn more](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/animation-direction)

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

attributes.name: easing
attributes.description:
The easing function to use for the animation. This can be a Web Awesome easing function or a custom easing function
such as `cubic-bezier(0, 1, .76, 1.14)`.

attributes.name: end-delay
attributes.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

attributes.name: iterations
attributes.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

attributes.name: iteration-start
attributes.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

attributes.name: playback-rate
attributes.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

events.name: wa-cancel
events.description: Emitted when the animation is canceled.

events.name: wa-finish
events.description: Emitted when the animation finishes.

events.name: wa-start
events.description: Emitted when the animation starts or restarts.

slots.description: The element to animate. Avoid slotting in more than one element, as subsequent ones will be ignored. To animate multiple elements, either wrap them in a single container or use multiple `<wa-animation>` elements.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Clears all keyframe effects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

methods.name: finish
methods.description: Sets the playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

components.name: WaBreadcrumb
components.description: Breadcrumbs provide a group of links so users can easily navigate a website's hierarchy.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The label to use for the breadcrumb control. This will not be shown on the screen, but it will be announced by
screen readers and other assistive devices to provide more context for users.

slots.description: One or more breadcrumb items to display.

slots.name: separator
slots.description: The separator to use between breadcrumb items. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

components.name: WaBreadcrumbItem
components.description: Breadcrumb Items are used inside breadcrumbs to represent different links.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Optional URL to direct the user to when the breadcrumb item is activated. When set, a link will be rendered
internally. When unset, a button will be rendered instead.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is set.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: The `rel` attribute to use on the link. Only used when `href` is set.

slots.description: The breadcrumb item's label.

slots.name: start
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed before the label.

slots.name: end
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed after the label.

slots.name: separator
slots.description: The separator to use for the breadcrumb item. This will only change the separator for this item. If you want to change it for all items in the group, set the separator on `<wa-breadcrumb>` instead.

cssParts.name: start
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `start` slot.

cssParts.name: end
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `end` slot.

cssParts.name: separator
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the separator.

components.name: WaAvatar
components.description: Avatars are used to represent a person or object.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: The image source to use for the avatar.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: A label to use to describe the avatar to assistive devices.

attributes.name: initials
attributes.description: Initials to use as a fallback when no image is available (1-2 characters max recommended).

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Indicates how the browser should load the image.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the avatar.

events.name: wa-error
events.description: The image could not be loaded. This may because of an invalid URL, a temporary network condition, or some unknown cause.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: The default icon to use when no image or initials are present. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssProperties.name: --size
cssProperties.description: The size of the avatar.

cssParts.name: icon
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the avatar's icon.

cssParts.name: initials
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the avatar's initials.

cssParts.name: image
cssParts.description: The avatar image. Only shown when the `image` attribute is set.

components.name: WaButton
components.description: Buttons represent actions that are available to the user.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The button's theme variant. Defaults to `neutral` if not within another element with a variant.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The button's visual appearance.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The button's size.

attributes.name: with-caret
attributes.description: Draws the button with a caret. Used to indicate that the button triggers a dropdown menu or similar behavior.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the button. Does not apply to link buttons.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Draws the button in a loading state.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style button with rounded edges.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of button. Note that the default value is `button` instead of `submit`, which is opposite of how native
`<button>` elements behave. When the type is `submit`, the button will submit the surrounding form.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The name of the button, submitted as a name/value pair with form data, but only when this button is the submitter.
This attribute is ignored when `href` is present.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of the button, submitted as a pair with the button's name as part of the form data, but only when this
button is the submitter. This attribute is ignored when `href` is present.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is present.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: When using `href`, this attribute will map to the underlying link's `rel` attribute.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is present.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
The "form owner" to associate the button with. If omitted, the closest containing form will be used instead. The
value of this attribute must be an id of a form in the same document or shadow root as the button.

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description: Used to override the form owner's `action` attribute.

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description: Used to override the form owner's `enctype` attribute.

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description: Used to override the form owner's `method` attribute.

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description: Used to override the form owner's `novalidate` attribute.

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description: Used to override the form owner's `target` attribute.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the button loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the button gains focus.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.description: The button's label.

slots.name: start
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed before the label.

slots.name: end
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed after the label.

cssParts.name: start
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `start` slot.

cssParts.name: end
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `end` slot.

cssParts.name: caret
cssParts.description: The button's caret icon, a `<wa-icon>` element.

cssParts.name: spinner
cssParts.description: The spinner that shows when the button is in the loading state.

methods.name: click
methods.description: Simulates a click on the button.

components.name: WaBadge
components.description: Badges are used to draw attention and display statuses or counts.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The badge's theme variant. Defaults to `brand` if not within another element with a variant.

attributes.name: appearance

attributes.name: pill

attributes.name: attention
attributes.description: Adds an animation to draw attention to the badge.

slots.description: The badge's content.

cssProperties.name: --pulse-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the badge's pulse effect when using `attention="pulse"`.

components.name: WaButtonGroup
components.description: Button groups can be used to group related buttons into sections.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
A label to use for the button group. This won't be displayed on the screen, but it will be announced by assistive
devices when interacting with the control and is strongly recommended.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: The button group's orientation.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The component's size.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The button group's theme variant. Defaults to `neutral` if not within another element with a variant.

slots.description: One or more `<wa-button>` elements to display in the button group.

components.name: WaCallout
components.description: Callouts are used to display important messages inline.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The callout's theme variant. Defaults to `brand` if not within another element with a variant.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The callout's visual appearance.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The callout's size.

slots.description: The callout's main content.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: An icon to show in the callout. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssParts.name: icon
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the optional icon.

cssParts.name: message
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the callout's main content.

components.name: WaCard
components.description: Cards can be used to group related subjects in a container.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The card's visual appearance.

attributes.name: with-header
attributes.description: Renders the card with a header. Only needed for SSR, otherwise is automatically added.

attributes.name: with-media
attributes.description: Renders the card with an image. Only needed for SSR, otherwise is automatically added.

attributes.name: with-footer
attributes.description: Renders the card with a footer. Only needed for SSR, otherwise is automatically added.

slots.description: The card's main content.

slots.name: header
slots.description: An optional header for the card.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: An optional footer for the card.

slots.name: media
slots.description: An optional media section to render at the start of the card.

cssProperties.name: --spacing
cssProperties.description: The amount of space around and between sections of the card. Expects a single value.

cssParts.name: media
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the card's media.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the card's header.

cssParts.name: body
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the card's main content.

cssParts.name: footer
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the card's footer.

components.name: WaCarousel
components.description: Carousels display an arbitrary number of content slides along a horizontal or vertical axis.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: When set, allows the user to navigate the carousel in the same direction indefinitely.

attributes.name: navigation
attributes.description: When set, show the carousel's navigation.

attributes.name: pagination
attributes.description: When set, show the carousel's pagination indicators.

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: When set, the slides will scroll automatically when the user is not interacting with them.

attributes.name: autoplay-interval
attributes.description: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, between each automatic scroll.

attributes.name: slides-per-page
attributes.description: Specifies how many slides should be shown at a given time.

attributes.name: slides-per-move
attributes.description:
Specifies the number of slides the carousel will advance when scrolling, useful when specifying a `slides-per-page`
greater than one. It can't be higher than `slides-per-page`.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Specifies the orientation in which the carousel will lay out.

attributes.name: mouse-dragging
attributes.description: When set, it is possible to scroll through the slides by dragging them with the mouse.

events.name: wa-slide-change
events.description: Emitted when the active slide changes.

slots.description: The carousel's main content, one or more `<wa-carousel-item>` elements.

slots.name: next-icon
slots.description: Optional next icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: previous-icon
slots.description: Optional previous icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssProperties.name: --aspect-ratio
cssProperties.description: The aspect ratio of each slide.

cssProperties.name: --scroll-hint
cssProperties.description: The amount of padding to apply to the scroll area, allowing adjacent slides to become partially visible as a scroll hint.

cssProperties.name: --slide-gap
cssProperties.description: The space between each slide.

cssParts.name: scroll-container
cssParts.description: The scroll container that wraps the slides.

cssParts.name: pagination-item-active
cssParts.description: Applied when the item is active.

methods.name: previous
methods.description: Move the carousel backward by `slides-per-move` slides.

methods.name: next
methods.description: Move the carousel forward by `slides-per-move` slides.

methods.name: goToSlide
methods.description: Scrolls the carousel to the slide specified by `index`.

components.name: WaCarouselItem
components.description: A carousel item represent a slide within a carousel.

slots.description: The carousel item's content..

cssProperties.name: --aspect-ratio
cssProperties.description: The slide's aspect ratio. Inherited from the carousel by default.

components.name: WaCheckbox
components.description: Checkboxes allow the user to toggle an option on or off.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the checkbox, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the checkbox, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The checkbox's size.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the checkbox.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description:
Draws the checkbox in an indeterminate state. This is usually applied to checkboxes that represents a "select
all/none" behavior when associated checkboxes have a mix of checked and unchecked states.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the checkbox a required field.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: The checkbox's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when the checked state changes.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the checkbox loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the checkbox gains focus.

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the checkbox receives input.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.description: The checkbox's label.

slots.name: hint
slots.description: Text that describes how to use the checkbox. Alternatively, you can use the `hint` attribute.

cssProperties.name: --checked-icon-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the checked and indeterminate icons.

cssProperties.name: --checked-icon-scale
cssProperties.description: The size of the checked and indeterminate icons relative to the checkbox.

cssParts.name: control
cssParts.description: The square container that wraps the checkbox's checked state.

cssParts.name: label
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the checkbox's label.

methods.name: click
methods.description: Simulates a click on the checkbox.

components.name: WaColorPicker
components.description: Color pickers allow the user to select a color.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The color picker's label. This will not be displayed, but it will be announced by assistive devices. If you need to
display HTML, you can use the `label` slot` instead.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: The color picker's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

attributes.name: format
attributes.description:
The format to use. If opacity is enabled, these will translate to HEXA, RGBA, HSLA, and HSVA respectively. The color
picker will accept user input in any format (including CSS color names) and convert it to the desired format.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Determines the size of the color picker's trigger

attributes.name: without-format-toggle
attributes.description: Removes the button that lets users toggle between format.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the form control, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the color picker.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Indicates whether or not the popup is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the popup, or you
can use the `show()` and `hide()` methods and this attribute will reflect the popup's open state.

attributes.name: opacity
attributes.description: Shows the opacity slider. Enabling this will cause the formatted value to be HEXA, RGBA, or HSLA.

attributes.name: uppercase
attributes.description: By default, values are lowercase. With this attribute, values will be uppercase instead.

attributes.name: swatches
attributes.description:
One or more predefined color swatches to display as presets in the color picker. Can include any format the color
picker can parse, including HEX(A), RGB(A), HSL(A), HSV(A), and CSS color names. Each color must be separated by a
semicolon (`;`). Alternatively, you can pass an array of color values to this property using JavaScript.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the color picker a required field.

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when the color picker's value changes.

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the color picker receives input.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the color picker loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the color picker receives focus.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.name: label
slots.description: The color picker's form label. Alternatively, you can use the `label` attribute.

slots.name: hint
slots.description: The color picker's form hint. Alternatively, you can use the `hint` attribute.

cssProperties.name: --grid-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the color grid.

cssProperties.name: --grid-height
cssProperties.description: The height of the color grid.

cssProperties.name: --grid-handle-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the color grid's handle.

cssProperties.name: --slider-height
cssProperties.description: The height of the hue and alpha sliders.

cssProperties.name: --slider-handle-size
cssProperties.description: The diameter of the slider's handle.

cssParts.name: swatches
cssParts.description: The container that holds the swatches.

cssParts.name: eyedropper-button__base
cssParts.description: The eye dropper button's exported `button` part.

cssParts.name: eyedropper-button__start
cssParts.description: The eye dropper button's exported `start` part.

cssParts.name: eyedropper-button__label
cssParts.description: The eye dropper button's exported `label` part.

cssParts.name: eyedropper-button__end
cssParts.description: The eye dropper button's exported `end` part.

cssParts.name: eyedropper-button__caret
cssParts.description: The eye dropper button's exported `caret` part.

methods.name: getHexString
methods.description: Generates a hex string from HSV values. Hue must be 0-360. All other arguments must be 0-100.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Sets focus on the color picker.

methods.name: blur
methods.description: Removes focus from the color picker.

methods.name: getFormattedValue
methods.description: Returns the current value as a string in the specified format.

methods.name: reportValidity
methods.description: Checks for validity and shows the browser's validation message if the control is invalid.

attributes.name: position

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when the position changes.

slots.name: before

slots.name: after

slots.name: handle

cssProperties.description: The width of the dividing line.

cssProperties.name: --handle-size

cssParts.name: base

cssParts.name: before

cssParts.name: after

cssParts.name: divider
cssParts.description: The divider that separates the before and after content.

components.name: WaCopyButton
components.description: Copies text data to the clipboard when the user clicks the trigger.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The text value to copy.

attributes.name: from
attributes.description:
An id that references an element in the same document from which data will be copied. If both this and `value` are
present, this value will take precedence. By default, the target element's `textContent` will be copied. To copy an
attribute, append the attribute name wrapped in square brackets, e.g. `from="el[value]"`. To copy a property,
append a dot and the property name, e.g. `from="el.value"`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the copy button.

attributes.name: copy-label
attributes.description: A custom label to show in the tooltip.

attributes.name: success-label
attributes.description: A custom label to show in the tooltip after copying.

attributes.name: error-label
attributes.description: A custom label to show in the tooltip when a copy error occurs.

attributes.name: feedback-duration
attributes.description: The length of time to show feedback before restoring the default trigger.

attributes.name: tooltip-placement
attributes.description: The preferred placement of the tooltip.

events.name: wa-copy
events.description: Emitted when the data has been copied.

events.name: wa-error
events.description: Emitted when the data could not be copied.

slots.name: copy-icon
slots.description: The icon to show in the default copy state. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: success-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when the content is copied. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: error-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when a copy error occurs. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssParts.name: copy-icon
cssParts.description: The container that holds the copy icon.

cssParts.name: success-icon
cssParts.description: The container that holds the success icon.

cssParts.name: error-icon
cssParts.description: The container that holds the error icon.

components.name: WaDetails
components.description: Details show a brief summary and expand to show additional content.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Indicates whether or not the details is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the details, or you
can use the `show()` and `hide()` methods and this attribute will reflect the details' open state.

attributes.name: summary
attributes.description: The summary to show in the header. If you need to display HTML, use the `summary` slot instead.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Groups related details elements. When one opens, others with the same name will close.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the details so it can't be toggled.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The element's visual appearance.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the details opens.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the details opens and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the details closes.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the details closes and all animations are complete.

slots.description: The details' main content.

slots.name: summary
slots.description: The details' summary. Alternatively, you can use the `summary` attribute.

slots.name: expand-icon
slots.description: Optional expand icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: collapse-icon
slots.description: Optional collapse icon to use instead of the default. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssProperties.name: --spacing
cssProperties.description: The amount of space around and between the details' content. Expects a single value.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The show duration to use when applying built-in animation classes.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The hide duration to use when applying built-in animation classes.

cssParts.name: base
cssParts.description: The inner `<details>` element used to render the component. Styles you apply to the component are automatically applied to this part, so you usually don't need to deal with it unless you need to set the `display` property.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: The header that wraps both the summary and the expand/collapse icon.

cssParts.name: summary
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the summary.

cssParts.name: icon
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the expand/collapse icons.

components.name: WaDialog
components.description: Dialogs, sometimes called "modals", appear above the page and require the user's immediate attention.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the dialog is open. Toggle this attribute to show and hide the dialog.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The dialog's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label, as it is required for
proper accessibility. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

attributes.name: without-header
attributes.description: Disables the header. This will also remove the default close button.

attributes.name: light-dismiss
attributes.description: When enabled, the dialog will be closed when the user clicks outside of it.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the dialog opens.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the dialog opens and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the dialog is requested to close. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the dialog from closing. You can inspect `event.detail.source` to see which element caused the dialog to close. If the source is the dialog element itself, the user has pressed [[Escape]] or the dialog has been closed programmatically. Avoid using this unless closing the dialog will result in destructive behavior such as data loss.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the dialog closes and all animations are complete.

slots.description: The dialog's main content.

slots.name: label
slots.description: The dialog's label. Alternatively, you can use the `label` attribute.

slots.name: header-actions
slots.description: Optional actions to add to the header. Works best with `<wa-button>`.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: The dialog's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.

cssProperties.name: --spacing
cssProperties.description: The amount of space around and between the dialog's content.

cssProperties.name: --width
cssProperties.description: The preferred width of the dialog. Note that the dialog will shrink to accommodate smaller screens.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when showing the dialog.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when hiding the dialog.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: The dialog's header. This element wraps the title and header actions.

cssParts.name: header-actions
cssParts.description: Optional actions to add to the header. Works best with `<wa-button>`.

components.name: WaDivider
components.description: Dividers are used to visually separate or group elements.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Sets the divider's orientation.

cssProperties.name: --color
cssProperties.description: The color of the divider.

cssProperties.name: --width
cssProperties.description: The width of the divider.

cssProperties.name: --spacing
cssProperties.description: The spacing of the divider.

components.name: WaDrawer
components.description: Drawers slide in from a container to expose additional options and information.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the drawer is open. Toggle this attribute to show and hide the drawer.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The drawer's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label, as it is required for
proper accessibility. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The direction from which the drawer will open.

attributes.name: without-header
attributes.description: Disables the header. This will also remove the default close button.

attributes.name: light-dismiss
attributes.description: When enabled, the drawer will be closed when the user clicks outside of it.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the drawer opens.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the drawer opens and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the drawer is requesting to close. Calling `event.preventDefault()` will prevent the drawer from closing. You can inspect `event.detail.source` to see which element caused the drawer to close. If the source is the drawer element itself, the user has pressed [[Escape]] or the drawer has been closed programmatically. Avoid using this unless closing the drawer will result in destructive behavior such as data loss.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the drawer closes and all animations are complete.

slots.description: The drawer's main content.

slots.name: label
slots.description: The drawer's label. Alternatively, you can use the `label` attribute.

slots.name: header-actions
slots.description: Optional actions to add to the header. Works best with `<wa-button>`.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: The drawer's footer, usually one or more buttons representing various options.

cssProperties.name: --spacing
cssProperties.description: The amount of space around and between the drawer's content.

cssProperties.name: --size
cssProperties.description: The preferred size of the drawer. This will be applied to the drawer's width or height depending on its `placement`. Note that the drawer will shrink to accommodate smaller screens.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when showing the drawer.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when hiding the drawer.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: The drawer's header. This element wraps the title and header actions.

cssParts.name: header-actions
cssParts.description: Optional actions to add to the header. Works best with `<wa-button>`.

components.name: WaDropdown
components.description:
Dropdowns display a list of options that can be triggered by a button or other element. They support
keyboard navigation, submenus, and various customization options.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Opens or closes the dropdown.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The dropdown's size.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The placement of the dropdown menu in reference to the trigger. The menu will shift to a more optimal location if
the preferred placement doesn't have enough room.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance of the dropdown menu from its trigger.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The offset of the dropdown menu along its trigger.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the dropdown is about to show.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the dropdown has been shown.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the dropdown is about to hide.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the dropdown has been hidden.

events.name: wa-select
events.description: Emitted when an item in the dropdown is selected.

slots.description: The dropdown's items, typically `<wa-dropdown-item>` elements.

slots.name: trigger
slots.description: The element that triggers the dropdown, such as a `<wa-button>` or `<button>`.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The duration of the show animation.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The duration of the hide animation.

components.name: WaDropdownItem
components.description: Represents an individual item within a dropdown menu, supporting standard items, checkboxes, and submenus.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The type of menu item to render.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
An optional value for the menu item. This is useful for determining which item was selected when listening to the
dropdown's `wa-select` event.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Set to `checkbox` to make the item a checkbox.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Set to true to check the dropdown item. Only valid when `type` is `checkbox`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the dropdown item.

attributes.name: submenuOpen
attributes.description: Whether the submenu is currently open.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the dropdown item loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the dropdown item gains focus.

slots.description: The dropdown item's label.

slots.name: icon
slots.description: An optional icon to display before the label.

slots.name: details
slots.description: Additional content or details to display after the label.

slots.name: submenu
slots.description: Submenu items, typically `<wa-dropdown-item>` elements, to create a nested menu.

cssParts.name: checkmark
cssParts.description: The checkmark icon (a `<wa-icon>` element) when the item is a checkbox.

cssParts.name: icon
cssParts.description: The container for the icon slot.

cssParts.name: label
cssParts.description: The container for the label slot.

cssParts.name: details
cssParts.description: The container for the details slot.

components.name: WaFormatBytes
components.description: Formats a number as a human readable bytes value.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number to format in bytes.

attributes.name: unit
attributes.description: The type of unit to display.

attributes.name: display
attributes.description: Determines how to display the result, e.g. "100 bytes", "100 b", or "100b".

components.name: WaFormatNumber
components.description: Formats a number using the specified locale and options.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The number to format.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The formatting style to use.

attributes.name: without-grouping
attributes.description: Turns off grouping separators.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description: The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code to use when formatting.

attributes.name: currency-display
attributes.description: How to display the currency.

attributes.name: minimum-integer-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of integer digits to use. Possible values are 1-21.

attributes.name: minimum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are 0-100.

attributes.name: maximum-fraction-digits
attributes.description: The maximum number of fraction digits to use. Possible values are 0-100.

attributes.name: minimum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The minimum number of significant digits to use. Possible values are 1-21.

attributes.name: maximum-significant-digits
attributes.description: The maximum number of significant digits to use,. Possible values are 1-21.

components.name: WaFormatDate
components.description: Formats a date/time using the specified locale and options.

attributes.name: date
attributes.description:
The date/time to format. If not set, the current date and time will be used. When passing a string, it's strongly
recommended to use the ISO 8601 format to ensure timezones are handled correctly. To convert a date to this format
in JavaScript, use [`date.toISOString()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toISOString).

attributes.name: weekday
attributes.description: The format for displaying the weekday.

attributes.name: era
attributes.description: The format for displaying the era.

attributes.name: year
attributes.description: The format for displaying the year.

attributes.name: month
attributes.description: The format for displaying the month.

attributes.name: day
attributes.description: The format for displaying the day.

attributes.name: hour
attributes.description: The format for displaying the hour.

attributes.name: minute
attributes.description: The format for displaying the minute.

attributes.name: second
attributes.description: The format for displaying the second.

attributes.name: time-zone-name
attributes.description: The format for displaying the time.

attributes.name: time-zone
attributes.description: The time zone to express the time in.

attributes.name: hour-format
attributes.description: The format for displaying the hour.

components.name: WaIcon
components.description: Icons are symbols that can be used to represent various options within an application.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the icon to draw. Available names depend on the icon library being used.

attributes.name: family
attributes.description:
The family of icons to choose from. For Font Awesome Free, valid options include `classic` and `brands`. For
Font Awesome Pro subscribers, valid options include, `classic`, `sharp`, `duotone`, `sharp-duotone`, and `brands`.
A valid kit code must be present to show pro icons via CDN. You can set `<html data-fa-kit-code="...">` to provide
one.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
The name of the icon's variant. For Font Awesome, valid options include `thin`, `light`, `regular`, and `solid` for
the `classic` and `sharp` families. Some variants require a Font Awesome Pro subscription. Custom icon libraries
may or may not use this property.

attributes.name: fixed-width
attributes.description: Draws the icon in a fixed-width both.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description:
An external URL of an SVG file. Be sure you trust the content you are including, as it will be executed as code and
can result in XSS attacks.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
An alternate description to use for assistive devices. If omitted, the icon will be considered presentational and
ignored by assistive devices.

attributes.name: library
attributes.description: The name of a registered custom icon library.

events.name: wa-load
events.description: Emitted when the icon has loaded. When using `spriteSheet: true` this will not emit.

events.name: wa-error
events.description: Emitted when the icon fails to load due to an error. When using `spriteSheet: true` this will not emit.

cssProperties.name: --primary-color
cssProperties.description: Sets a duotone icon's primary color.

cssProperties.name: --primary-opacity
cssProperties.description: Sets a duotone icon's primary opacity.

cssProperties.name: --secondary-color
cssProperties.description: Sets a duotone icon's secondary color.

cssProperties.name: --secondary-opacity
cssProperties.description: Sets a duotone icon's secondary opacity.

cssParts.name: use
cssParts.description: The `<use>` element generated when using `spriteSheet: true`

components.name: WaInclude
components.description: Includes give you the power to embed external HTML files into the page.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description:
The location of the HTML file to include. Be sure you trust the content you are including as it will be executed as
code and can result in XSS attacks.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The fetch mode to use.

attributes.name: allow-scripts
attributes.description:
Allows included scripts to be executed. Be sure you trust the content you are including as it will be executed as
code and can result in XSS attacks.

events.name: wa-load
events.description: Emitted when the included file is loaded.

events.name: wa-error
events.description: Emitted when the included file fails to load due to an error.

components.name: WaOption
components.description: Options define the selectable items within a select component.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The option's value. When selected, the containing form control will receive this value. The value must be unique
from other options in the same group. Values may not contain spaces, as spaces are used as delimiters when listing
multiple values.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Draws the option in a disabled state, preventing selection.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Selects an option initially.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
The option’s plain text label.
Usually automatically generated, but can be useful to provide manually for cases involving complex content.

slots.description: The option's label.

slots.name: start
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed before the label.

slots.name: end
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed after the label.

cssParts.name: start
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `start` slot.

cssParts.name: end
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `end` slot.

components.name: WaMutationObserver
components.description: The Mutation Observer component offers a thin, declarative interface to the [`MutationObserver API`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MutationObserver).

attributes.name: attr
attributes.description:
Watches for changes to attributes. To watch only specific attributes, separate them by a space, e.g.
`attr="class id title"`. To watch all attributes, use `*`.

attributes.name: attr-old-value
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the attribute's previous value should be recorded when monitoring changes.

attributes.name: char-data
attributes.description: Watches for changes to the character data contained within the node.

attributes.name: char-data-old-value
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the previous value of the node's text should be recorded.

attributes.name: child-list
attributes.description: Watches for the addition or removal of new child nodes.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the observer.

events.name: wa-mutation
events.description: Emitted when a mutation occurs.

slots.description: The content to watch for mutations.

components.name: WaInput
components.description: Inputs collect data from the user.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of input. Works the same as a native `<input>` element, but only a subset of types are supported. Defaults
to `text`.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The input's size.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The input's visual appearance.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style input with rounded edges.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The input's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: The input's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

attributes.name: with-clear
attributes.description: Adds a clear button when the input is not empty.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the input is empty.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the input readonly.

attributes.name: password-toggle
attributes.description: Adds a button to toggle the password's visibility. Only applies to password types.

attributes.name: password-visible
attributes.description: Determines whether or not the password is currently visible. Only applies to password input types.

attributes.name: without-spin-buttons
attributes.description: Hides the browser's built-in increment/decrement spin buttons for number inputs.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the input a required field.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A regular expression pattern to validate input against.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The input's minimum value. Only applies to date and number input types.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The input's maximum value. Only applies to date and number input types.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Specifies the granularity that the value must adhere to, or the special value `any` which means no stepping is
implied, allowing any numeric value. Only applies to date and number input types.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered by the user.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Indicates whether the browser's autocorrect feature is on or off.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Specifies what permission the browser has to provide assistance in filling out form field values. Refer to
[this page on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for available values.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Indicates that the input should receive focus on page load.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: Used to customize the label or icon of the Enter key on virtual keyboards.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the input.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Tells the browser what type of data will be entered by the user, allowing it to display the appropriate virtual
keyboard on supportive devices.

attributes.name: with-label
attributes.description: Used for SSR. Will determine if the SSRed component will have the label slot rendered on initial paint.

attributes.name: with-hint
attributes.description: Used for SSR. Will determine if the SSRed component will have the hint slot rendered on initial paint.

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the control receives input.

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when an alteration to the control's value is committed by the user.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the control loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the control gains focus.

events.name: wa-clear
events.description: Emitted when the clear button is activated.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.name: label
slots.description: The input's label. Alternatively, you can use the `label` attribute.

slots.name: start
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed at the start of the input control.

slots.name: end
slots.description: An element, such as `<wa-icon>`, placed at the end of the input control.

slots.name: clear-icon
slots.description: An icon to use in lieu of the default clear icon.

slots.name: show-password-icon
slots.description: An icon to use in lieu of the default show password icon.

slots.name: hide-password-icon
slots.description: An icon to use in lieu of the default hide password icon.

slots.name: hint
slots.description: Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the `hint` attribute.

cssParts.name: input
cssParts.description: The wrapper being rendered as an input

cssParts.name: start
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `start` slot.

cssParts.name: end
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the `end` slot.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects all the text in the input.

methods.name: setSelectionRange
methods.description: Sets the start and end positions of the text selection (0-based).

methods.name: setRangeText
methods.description: Replaces a range of text with a new string.

methods.name: showPicker
methods.description: Displays the browser picker for an input element (only works if the browser supports it for the input type).

methods.name: stepUp
methods.description: Increments the value of a numeric input type by the value of the step attribute.

methods.name: stepDown
methods.description: Decrements the value of a numeric input type by the value of the step attribute.

components.name: WaPage
components.description: Pages offer an easy way to scaffold entire page layouts using minimal markup.

attributes.name: view
attributes.description:
The view is a reflection of the "mobileBreakpoint", when the page is larger than the `mobile-breakpoint` (768px by
default), it is considered to be a "desktop" view. The view is merely a way to distinguish when to show/hide the
navigation. You can use additional media queries to make other adjustments to content as necessary.
The default is "desktop" because the "mobile navigation drawer" isn't accessible via SSR due to drawer requiring JS.

attributes.name: nav-open
attributes.description: Whether or not the navigation drawer is open. Note, the navigation drawer is only "open" on mobile views.

attributes.name: mobile-breakpoint
attributes.description:
At what page width to hide the "navigation" slot and collapse into a hamburger button.
Accepts both numbers (interpreted as px) and CSS lengths (e.g. `50em`), which are resolved based on the root element.

attributes.name: navigation-placement
attributes.description: Where to place the navigation when in the mobile viewport.

attributes.name: disable-navigation-toggle
attributes.description:
Determines whether or not to hide the default hamburger button.
This will automatically flip to "true" if you add an element with `data-toggle-nav` anywhere in the element light DOM.
Generally this will be set for you and you don't need to do anything, unless you're using SSR, in which case you should set this manually for initial page loads.

slots.description: The page's main content.

slots.name: banner
slots.description: The banner that gets display above the header. The banner will not be shown if no content is provided.

slots.name: header
slots.description: The header to display at the top of the page. If a banner is present, the header will appear below the banner. The header will not be shown if there is no content.

slots.name: subheader
slots.description: A subheader to display below the `header`. This is a good place to put things like breadcrumbs.

slots.name: menu
slots.description: The left side of the page. If you slot an element in here, you will override the default `navigation` slot and will be handling navigation on your own. This also will not disable the fallback behavior of the navigation button. This section "sticks" to the top as the page scrolls.

slots.name: navigation-header
slots.description: The header for a navigation area. On mobile this will be the header for `<wa-drawer>`.

slots.name: navigation
slots.description: The main content to display in the navigation area. This is displayed on the left side of the page, if `menu` is not used. This section "sticks" to the top as the page scrolls.

slots.name: navigation-footer
slots.description: The footer for a navigation area. On mobile this will be the footer for `<wa-drawer>`.

slots.name: navigation-toggle
slots.description: Use this slot to slot in your own button + icon for toggling the navigation drawer. By default it is a `<wa-button>` + a 3 bars `<wa-icon>`

slots.name: navigation-toggle-icon
slots.description: Use this to slot in your own icon for toggling the navigation drawer. By default it is 3 bars `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: main-header
slots.description: Header to display inline above the main content.

slots.name: main-footer
slots.description: Footer to display inline below the main content.

slots.name: aside
slots.description: Content to be shown on the right side of the page. Typically contains a table of contents, ads, etc. This section "sticks" to the top as the page scrolls.

slots.name: skip-to-content
slots.description: The "skip to content" slot. You can override this If you would like to override the `Skip to content` button and add additional "Skip to X", they can be inserted here.

slots.name: footer
slots.description: The content to display in the footer. This is always displayed underneath the viewport so will always make the page "scrollable".

cssProperties.name: --menu-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the page's "menu" section.

cssProperties.name: --main-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the page's "main" section.

cssProperties.name: --aside-width
cssProperties.description: The wide of the page's "aside" section.

cssProperties.name: --banner-height
cssProperties.description: The height of the banner. This gets calculated when the page initializes. If the height is known, you can set it here to prevent shifting when the page loads.

cssProperties.name: --header-height
cssProperties.description: The height of the header. This gets calculated when the page initializes. If the height is known, you can set it here to prevent shifting when the page loads.

cssProperties.name: --subheader-height
cssProperties.description: The height of the subheader. This gets calculated when the page initializes. If the height is known, you can set it here to prevent shifting when the page loads.

cssParts.name: banner
cssParts.description: The banner to show above header.

cssParts.name: header
cssParts.description: The header, usually for top level navigation / branding.

cssParts.name: subheader
cssParts.description: Shown below the header, usually intended for things like breadcrumbs and other page level navigation.

cssParts.name: body
cssParts.description: The wrapper around menu, main, and aside.

cssParts.name: menu
cssParts.description: The left hand side of the page. Generally intended for navigation.

cssParts.name: navigation
cssParts.description: The `<nav>` that wraps the navigation slots on desktop viewports.

cssParts.name: navigation-header
cssParts.description: The header for a navigation area. On mobile this will be the header for `<wa-drawer>`.

cssParts.name: navigation-footer
cssParts.description: The footer for a navigation area. On mobile this will be the footer for `<wa-drawer>`.

cssParts.name: navigation-toggle
cssParts.description: The default `<wa-button>` that will toggle the `<wa-drawer>` for mobile viewports.

cssParts.name: navigation-toggle-icon
cssParts.description: The default `<wa-icon>` displayed inside of the navigation-toggle button.

cssParts.name: aside
cssParts.description: The right hand side of the page. Used for things like table of contents, ads, etc.

cssParts.name: footer
cssParts.description: The footer of the page. This is always below the initial viewport size.

cssParts.name: dialog-wrapper
cssParts.description: A wrapper around elements such as dialogs or other modal-like elements.

components.name: WaPopover
components.description: Popovers display contextual content and interactive elements in a floating panel.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the popover. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the popover
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Shows or hides the popover.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the popover away from its target.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the popover along its target.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description: The ID of the popover's anchor element. This must be an interactive/focusable element such as a button.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the popover begins to show. Canceling this event will stop the popover from showing.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the popover has shown and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the popover begins to hide. Canceling this event will stop the popover from hiding.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the popover has hidden and all animations are complete.

cssParts.name: body

components.name: WaPopup
components.description: Popup is a utility that lets you declaratively anchor "popup" containers to another element.

attributes.name: anchor
attributes.description:
The element the popup will be anchored to. If the anchor lives outside of the popup, you can provide the anchor
element `id`, a DOM element reference, or a `VirtualElement`. If the anchor lives inside the popup, use the
`anchor` slot instead.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description:
Activates the positioning logic and shows the popup. When this attribute is removed, the positioning logic is torn
down and the popup will be hidden.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the popup. Note that the actual placement will vary as configured to keep the
panel inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: boundary
attributes.description: The bounding box to use for flipping, shifting, and auto-sizing.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its anchor.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its anchor.

attributes.name: arrow
attributes.description:
Attaches an arrow to the popup. The arrow's size and color can be customized using the `--arrow-size` and
`--arrow-color` custom properties. For additional customizations, you can also target the arrow using
`::part(arrow)` in your stylesheet.

attributes.name: arrow-placement
attributes.description:
The placement of the arrow. The default is `anchor`, which will align the arrow as close to the center of the
anchor as possible, considering available space and `arrow-padding`. A value of `start`, `end`, or `center` will
align the arrow to the start, end, or center of the popover instead.

attributes.name: arrow-padding
attributes.description:
The amount of padding between the arrow and the edges of the popup. If the popup has a border-radius, for example,
this will prevent it from overflowing the corners.

attributes.name: flip
attributes.description:
When set, placement of the popup will flip to the opposite site to keep it in view. You can use
`flipFallbackPlacements` to further configure how the fallback placement is determined.

attributes.name: flip-fallback-placements
attributes.description:
If the preferred placement doesn't fit, popup will be tested in these fallback placements until one fits. Must be a
string of any number of placements separated by a space, e.g. "top bottom left". If no placement fits, the flip
fallback strategy will be used instead.

attributes.name: flip-fallback-strategy
attributes.description:
When neither the preferred placement nor the fallback placements fit, this value will be used to determine whether
the popup should be positioned using the best available fit based on available space or as it was initially
preferred.

attributes.name: flipBoundary
attributes.description:
The flip boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when flipping. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

attributes.name: flip-padding
attributes.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the flip behavior will occur.

attributes.name: shift
attributes.description: Moves the popup along the axis to keep it in view when clipped.

attributes.name: shiftBoundary
attributes.description:
The shift boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when shifting. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

attributes.name: shift-padding
attributes.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the shift behavior will occur.

attributes.name: auto-size
attributes.description: When set, this will cause the popup to automatically resize itself to prevent it from overflowing.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Syncs the popup's width or height to that of the anchor element.

attributes.name: autoSizeBoundary
attributes.description:
The auto-size boundary describes clipping element(s) that overflow will be checked relative to when resizing. By
default, the boundary includes overflow ancestors that will cause the element to be clipped. If needed, you can
change the boundary by passing a reference to one or more elements to this property.

attributes.name: auto-size-padding
attributes.description: The amount of padding, in pixels, to exceed before the auto-size behavior will occur.

attributes.name: hover-bridge
attributes.description:
When a gap exists between the anchor and the popup element, this option will add a "hover bridge" that fills the
gap using an invisible element. This makes listening for events such as `mouseenter` and `mouseleave` more sane
because the pointer never technically leaves the element. The hover bridge will only be drawn when the popover is
active.

events.name: wa-reposition
events.description: Emitted when the popup is repositioned. This event can fire a lot, so avoid putting expensive operations in your listener or consider debouncing it.

slots.description: The popup's content.

slots.name: anchor
slots.description: The element the popup will be anchored to. If the anchor lives outside of the popup, you can use the `anchor` attribute or property instead.

cssProperties.name: --arrow-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the arrow. Note that an arrow won't be shown unless the `arrow` attribute is used.

cssProperties.name: --arrow-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the arrow.

cssProperties.name: --auto-size-available-width
cssProperties.description: A read-only custom property that determines the amount of width the popup can be before overflowing. Useful for positioning child elements that need to overflow. This property is only available when using `auto-size`.

cssProperties.name: --auto-size-available-height
cssProperties.description: A read-only custom property that determines the amount of height the popup can be before overflowing. Useful for positioning child elements that need to overflow. This property is only available when using `auto-size`.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The show duration to use when applying built-in animation classes.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The hide duration to use when applying built-in animation classes.

cssParts.name: arrow
cssParts.description: The arrow's container. Avoid setting `top|bottom|left|right` properties, as these values are assigned dynamically as the popup moves. This is most useful for applying a background color to match the popup, and maybe a border or box shadow.

cssParts.name: popup
cssParts.description: The popup's container. Useful for setting a background color, box shadow, etc.

cssParts.name: hover-bridge
cssParts.description: The hover bridge element. Only available when the `hover-bridge` option is enabled.

methods.name: reposition
methods.description: Forces the popup to recalculate and reposition itself.

components.name: WaRating

attributes.name: precision

The precision at which the rating will increase and decrease. For example, to allow half-star ratings, set this
attribute to `0.5`.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the rating readonly.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the rating.

attributes.name: getSymbol
attributes.description:
A function that customizes the symbol to be rendered. The first and only argument is the rating's current value.
The function should return a string containing trusted HTML of the symbol to render at the specified value. Works
well with `<wa-icon>` elements.

attributes.name: size

events.name: change

events.name: wa-hover
events.description: Emitted when the user hovers over a value. The `phase` property indicates when hovering starts, moves to a new value, or ends. The `value` property tells what the rating's value would be if the user were to commit to the hovered value.

cssProperties.name: --symbol-color

cssProperties.name: --symbol-color-active

cssProperties.name: --symbol-spacing

components.name: WaRelativeTime

attributes.name: date
attributes.description:
The date from which to calculate time from. If not set, the current date and time will be used. When passing a
string, it's strongly recommended to use the ISO 8601 format to ensure timezones are handled correctly. To convert
a date to this format in JavaScript, use [`date.toISOString()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toISOString).

attributes.name: format
attributes.description: The formatting style to use.

attributes.name: numeric
attributes.description:
When `auto`, values such as "yesterday" and "tomorrow" will be shown when possible. When `always`, values such as
"1 day ago" and "in 1 day" will be shown.

attributes.name: sync
attributes.description: Keep the displayed value up to date as time passes.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Indicates whether or not the select is open. You can toggle this attribute to show and hide the menu, or you can
use the `show()` and `hide()` methods and this attribute will reflect the select's open state.

attributes.name: appearance

attributes.name: pill

attributes.name: hint

By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
