components.name: WaSplitPanel
components.description: Split panels display two adjacent panels, allowing the user to reposition them.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
The current position of the divider from the primary panel's edge as a percentage 0-100. Defaults to 50% of the
container's initial size.

attributes.name: position-in-pixels
attributes.description: The current position of the divider from the primary panel's edge in pixels.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Sets the split panel's orientation.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables resizing. Note that the position may still change as a result of resizing the host element.

attributes.name: primary
attributes.description:
If no primary panel is designated, both panels will resize proportionally when the host element is resized. If a
primary panel is designated, it will maintain its size and the other panel will grow or shrink as needed when the
host element is resized.

attributes.name: snap
attributes.description:
One or more space-separated values at which the divider should snap. Values can be in pixels or percentages, e.g.
`"100px 50%"`.

attributes.name: snap-threshold
attributes.description: How close the divider must be to a snap point until snapping occurs.

events.name: wa-reposition
events.description: Emitted when the divider's position changes.

slots.name: start
slots.description: Content to place in the start panel.

slots.name: end
slots.description: Content to place in the end panel.

slots.name: divider
slots.description: The divider. Useful for slotting in a custom icon that renders as a handle.

cssProperties.name: --divider-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the visible divider.

cssProperties.name: --divider-hit-area
cssProperties.description: The invisible region around the divider where dragging can occur. This is usually wider than the divider to facilitate easier dragging.

cssProperties.name: --min
cssProperties.description: The minimum allowed size of the primary panel.

cssProperties.name: --max
cssProperties.description: The maximum allowed size of the primary panel.

cssParts.name: panel
cssParts.description: Targets both the start and end panels.

cssParts.name: divider
cssParts.description: The divider that separates the start and end panels.

components.name: WaSwitch
components.description: Switches allow the user to toggle an option on or off.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the switch, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the switch, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The switch's size.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the switch.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the switch a required field.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: The switch's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

attributes.name: with-hint
attributes.description: Used for SSR. If you slot in hint, make sure to add `with-hint` to your component to get it to properly render with SSR.

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when the control's checked state changes.

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the control receives input.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the control loses focus.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the control gains focus.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.description: The switch's label.

slots.name: hint
slots.description: Text that describes how to use the switch. Alternatively, you can use the `hint` attribute.

cssProperties.name: --width
cssProperties.description: The width of the switch.

cssProperties.name: --height
cssProperties.description: The height of the switch.

cssProperties.name: --thumb-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the thumb.

cssParts.name: control
cssParts.description: The control that houses the switch's thumb.

methods.name: click
methods.description: Simulates a click on the switch.

components.name: WaTab
components.description: Tabs are used inside [tab groups](/docs/components/tab-group) to represent and activate [tab panels](/docs/components/tab-panel).

attributes.name: panel
attributes.description: The name of the tab panel this tab is associated with. The panel must be located in the same tab group.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the tab and prevents selection.

slots.description: The tab's label.

components.name: WaTabGroup
components.description: Tab groups organize content into a container that shows one section at a time.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Sets the active tab.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The placement of the tabs.

attributes.name: activation
attributes.description:
When set to auto, navigating tabs with the arrow keys will instantly show the corresponding tab panel. When set to
manual, the tab will receive focus but will not show until the user presses spacebar or enter.

attributes.name: without-scroll-controls
attributes.description: Disables the scroll arrows that appear when tabs overflow.

events.name: wa-tab-show
events.description: Emitted when a tab is shown.

events.name: wa-tab-hide
events.description: Emitted when a tab is hidden.

slots.description: Used for grouping tab panels in the tab group. Must be `<wa-tab-panel>` elements.

slots.name: nav
slots.description: Used for grouping tabs in the tab group. Must be `<wa-tab>` elements. Note that `<wa-tab>` will set this slot on itself automatically.

cssProperties.name: --indicator-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the active tab indicator.

cssProperties.name: --track-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the indicator's track (the line that separates tabs from panels).

cssProperties.name: --track-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the indicator's track (the line that separates tabs from panels).

cssParts.name: nav
cssParts.description: The tab group's navigation container where tabs are slotted in.

cssParts.name: tabs
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the tabs.

cssParts.name: body
cssParts.description: The tab group's body where tab panels are slotted in.

cssParts.name: scroll-button
cssParts.description: The previous/next scroll buttons that show when tabs are scrollable, a `<wa-button>`.

components.name: WaTabPanel
components.description: Tab panels are used inside [tab groups](/docs/components/tab-group) to display tabbed content.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The tab panel's name.

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: When true, the tab panel will be shown.

slots.description: The tab panel's content.

cssProperties.name: --padding
cssProperties.description: The tab panel's padding.

components.name: WaTag
components.description: Tags are used as labels to organize things or to indicate a selection.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description: The tag's theme variant. Defaults to `neutral` if not within another element with a variant.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The tag's visual appearance.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The tag's size.

attributes.name: pill
attributes.description: Draws a pill-style tag with rounded edges.

attributes.name: with-remove
attributes.description: Makes the tag removable and shows a remove button.

events.name: wa-remove
events.description: Emitted when the remove button is activated.

slots.description: The tag's content.

components.name: WaTextarea
components.description: Textareas collect data from the user and allow multiple lines of text.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the textarea, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The textarea's size.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: The textarea's visual appearance.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The textarea's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

attributes.name: hint
attributes.description: The textarea's hint. If you need to display HTML, use the `hint` slot instead.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the input is empty.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows to display by default.

attributes.name: resize
attributes.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the textarea.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the textarea readonly.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Makes the textarea a required field.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered by the user.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Indicates whether the browser's autocorrect feature is on or off.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Specifies what permission the browser has to provide assistance in filling out form field values. Refer to
[this page on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for available values.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Indicates that the input should receive focus on page load.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: Used to customize the label or icon of the Enter key on virtual keyboards.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Enables spell checking on the textarea.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Tells the browser what type of data will be entered by the user, allowing it to display the appropriate virtual
keyboard on supportive devices.

attributes.name: with-label
attributes.description: Used for SSR. If you're slotting in a `label` element, make sure to set this to `true`.

attributes.name: with-hint
attributes.description: Used for SSR. If you're slotting in a `hint` element, make sure to set this to `true`.

events.name: blur
events.description: Emitted when the control loses focus.

events.name: change
events.description: Emitted when an alteration to the control's value is committed by the user.

events.name: focus
events.description: Emitted when the control gains focus.

events.name: input
events.description: Emitted when the control receives input.

events.name: wa-invalid
events.description: Emitted when the form control has been checked for validity and its constraints aren't satisfied.

slots.name: label
slots.description: The textarea's label. Alternatively, you can use the `label` attribute.

slots.name: hint
slots.description: Text that describes how to use the input. Alternatively, you can use the `hint` attribute.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects all the text in the textarea.

methods.name: scrollPosition
methods.description: Gets or sets the textarea's scroll position.

methods.name: setSelectionRange
methods.description: Sets the start and end positions of the text selection (0-based).

methods.name: setRangeText
methods.description: Replaces a range of text with a new string.

components.name: WaTooltip
components.description: Tooltips display additional information based on a specific action.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the tooltip so it won't show when triggered.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the tooltip is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

attributes.name: show-delay
attributes.description: The amount of time to wait before showing the tooltip when the user mouses in.

attributes.name: hide-delay
attributes.description: The amount of time to wait before hiding the tooltip when the user mouses out..

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple
options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated
programmatically.

events.name: wa-show
events.description: Emitted when the tooltip begins to show.

events.name: wa-after-show
events.description: Emitted after the tooltip has shown and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-hide
events.description: Emitted when the tooltip begins to hide.

events.name: wa-after-hide
events.description: Emitted after the tooltip has hidden and all animations are complete.

slots.description: The tooltip's default slot where any content should live. Interactive content should be avoided.

cssProperties.name: --max-width
cssProperties.description: The maximum width of the tooltip before its content will wrap.

cssParts.name: base
cssParts.description: The component's base wrapper, an `<wa-popup>` element.

cssParts.name: base__popup
cssParts.description: The popup's exported `popup` part. Use this to target the tooltip's popup container.

cssParts.name: base__arrow
cssParts.description: The popup's exported `arrow` part. Use this to target the tooltip's arrow.

cssParts.name: body
cssParts.description: The tooltip's body where its content is rendered.

components.name: WaTree
components.description: Trees allow you to display a hierarchical list of selectable [tree items](/docs/components/tree-item). Items with children can be expanded and collapsed as desired by the user.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description:
The selection behavior of the tree. Single selection allows only one node to be selected at a time. Multiple
displays checkboxes and allows more than one node to be selected. Leaf allows only leaf nodes to be selected.

events.name: wa-selection-change
events.description: Emitted when a tree item is selected or deselected.

slots.description: The default slot.

slots.name: expand-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when the tree item is expanded. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

slots.name: collapse-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when the tree item is collapsed. Works best with `<wa-icon>`.

cssProperties.name: --indent-size
cssProperties.description: The size of the indentation for nested items.

cssProperties.name: --indent-guide-color
cssProperties.description: The color of the indentation line.

cssProperties.name: --indent-guide-offset
cssProperties.description: The amount of vertical spacing to leave between the top and bottom of the indentation line's starting position.

cssProperties.name: --indent-guide-style
cssProperties.description: The style of the indentation line, e.g. solid, dotted, dashed.

cssProperties.name: --indent-guide-width
cssProperties.description: The width of the indentation line.

components.name: WaTreeItem
components.description: A tree item serves as a hierarchical node that lives inside a [tree](/docs/components/tree).

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Expands the tree item.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Draws the tree item in a selected state.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the tree item.

attributes.name: lazy
attributes.description: Enables lazy loading behavior.

events.name: wa-expand
events.description: Emitted when the tree item expands.

events.name: wa-after-expand
events.description: Emitted after the tree item expands and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-collapse
events.description: Emitted when the tree item collapses.

events.name: wa-after-collapse
events.description: Emitted after the tree item collapses and all animations are complete.

events.name: wa-lazy-change
events.description: Emitted when the tree item's lazy state changes.

events.name: wa-lazy-load
events.description: Emitted when a lazy item is selected. Use this event to asynchronously load data and append items to the tree before expanding. After appending new items, remove the `lazy` attribute to remove the loading state and update the tree.

slots.description: The default slot.

slots.name: expand-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when the tree item is expanded.

slots.name: collapse-icon
slots.description: The icon to show when the tree item is collapsed.

cssProperties.name: --show-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when expanding tree items.

cssProperties.name: --hide-duration
cssProperties.description: The animation duration when collapsing tree items.

cssParts.name: item
cssParts.description: The tree item's container. This element wraps everything except slotted tree item children.

cssParts.name: expand-button
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the tree item's expand button and spinner.

cssParts.name: spinner
cssParts.description: The spinner that shows when a lazy tree item is in the loading state.

cssParts.name: children
cssParts.description: The container that wraps the tree item's nested children.

cssParts.name: checkbox
cssParts.description: The checkbox that shows when using multiselect.

methods.name: getChildrenItems
methods.description: Gets all the nested tree items in this node.

components.name: WaZoomableFrame
components.description: Zoomable frames render iframe content with zoom and interaction controls.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The URL of the content to display.

attributes.name: srcdoc
attributes.description: Inline HTML to display.

attributes.name: allowfullscreen
attributes.description: Allows fullscreen mode.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Controls iframe loading behavior.

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Controls referrer information.

attributes.name: sandbox
attributes.description: Security restrictions for the iframe.

attributes.name: zoom
attributes.description: The current zoom of the frame, e.g. 0 = 0% and 1 = 100%.

attributes.name: zoom-levels
attributes.description: The zoom levels to step through when using zoom controls. This does not restrict programmatic changes to the zoom.

attributes.name: without-controls
attributes.description: Removes the zoom controls.

attributes.name: without-interaction
attributes.description: Disables interaction when present.

events.name: load
events.description: Emitted when the internal iframe when it finishes loading.

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted from the internal iframe when it fails to load.

slots.name: zoom-in-icon
slots.description: The slot that contains the zoom in icon.

slots.name: zoom-out-icon
slots.description: The slot that contains the zoom out icon.

cssParts.name: controls
cssParts.description: The container that surrounds zoom control buttons.

methods.name: zoomIn
methods.description: Zooms in to the next available zoom level.

methods.name: zoomOut
methods.description: Zooms out to the previous available zoom level.
